briefdescription.para: Copy coordinates into provided grids. If grids are too small, copy will be truncated. If grids are too large, extra elements will not be overwritten (fill with pad characters before copying). Returns the number of coordinates copied.

memberdef.argsstring: (Grid< float, 2, isCUDA > &c, Grid< float, 2, isCUDA > &t, Grid< float, 1, isCUDA > &r) const
memberdef.name: copyTo

briefdescription.para: Copy coordinates into provided grids. If grids are too small, copy will be truncated. If grids are too large, extra elements will not be overwritten (fill with pad characters before copying). Returns the number of coordinates copied. Vectored types are copied a row at a time so truncation/expansion happens per-atom.
return true if index types are available (or no atoms)
return true if vector types are available (or no atoms)
convert index types to vector types in-place

parameterdescription.para: - if true will create an additional type at end (has zero radii if type radii are provided is true)
- if provided, convert radii array to be type indexed,

briefdescription.para: return number of types
set number of (indexed) types
compute the sum of each type class across vector types for this set, if zerofirst is false, add to existing elements of sum
number of atoms
return mean of coordinates
return deep copy
size this to have the same size as s without copying data
copy contents of src into this, attempting to avoid reallocation if possible
merge provided sets into this, reallocating as necessary
for debugging
A collection of typed atomic coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Types may be specified either as an index or a dense vector. Typically, only one type formated will be initialized although a vector one-hot encoding of an index type can be created.
